pr_title: CAMEL-14360 - Allow overriding of message key and partition key for ggregated kafka messages

timeline.message: CAMEL-14360 - Allow overriding of message key and partition key for aggregated kafka messages
CAMEL-14362 - Set metadata for each aggregated kafka message separately

timeline.bodyText: Sorry, I am bit confused here, was there a logical reason to use pair with the message body?
timeline.author: omarsmak

replies.bodyText:
If the left of pair is instance of Message or Exchange it will then be used to set metadata on this Exchange/Message instance. If this is instance of something else, no metadata will be set at all.
If we return only the ProducerRecord, we loose information to what Message/Exchange it refers to and we cannot set metadata returned by Kafka producer.
replies.author: rgala

timeline.message: CAMEL-14362 - Use KeyValueHolder instead of Pair

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if you should also check for instanceof Message here, and if its a message, you can use message -> getExchange to get that to set the exception.
timeline.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText: Added as requested. I also wonder if checking of null result of getExchange would not be a good idea.
replies.author: rgala

timeline.message: CMAEL-14362 - Code formatting changes and Exchange retrieval from Message instance
CAMEL-14362 - Additional check for null return value of getExchange
